content.description: Excellent climb, with thoughtful moves and hidden holds that make it a mental as well as physical challenge. Fun climb!
content.protection: Bolts with chains and rings at the top.
content.location: Left-most climb at Mahican wall. The base of the route is steep and precarious, it's a good idea for the belayer to anchor to a tree

content.description: The climb follows the blunt, sloping, right-hand arete.
content.location: From the obvious corner of Tossin Ze Chossin, Winkler's Bushwack is the rightmost line of bolts on the right face.

content.description: Delicate face climbing throughout. Two cruxes. One down low and one up top.
content.location: Just right of Tossin Ze Chossin

content.description: The climb follows the crack in the corner straight upward. Bolts and anchor on right-hand wall. Enjoyable climb with some stemming, jamming, face holds all available.
increasingly difficult until just below the top. there are some flakes low down that will dislodge eventually...
content.location: slab line just left of the Hysteresis corner

content.description: Cuddle in the corner on this warm and fuzzy crack climb. It's short and easy with plenty of holds on the face and in the crack. Use the left short directional chain (at the last bolt) to keep your rope from getting jammed in the top of the crack.
content.location: Continue left around the corner from Blue Moon in August to the next notch and face with bolts.

content.description: Climb slightly right of the bolt line straight up following decent side pulls and pinches to the roof. The beginning half is slightly overhung making you just pumped enough to have to commit to the roof pull and balancy moves to the anchor.
content.location: Just before the slab climbs marked by a chain hanging from the second bolt.

content.description:
This one of the better lines at Thacher, the rock quality is good and the movement is excellent. 

  Climb a short crimpy face through two clips to a juggy ledge.  Rest up and fire through the next 15' of technical, sequency climbing on limestone crimps.  Finish through a pockety section of dark rock to a big jug ledge.
content.location: Second line you come to on the Mahican Wall.

content.description: Start with a hard bulge to a crux transition onto the face. Continue up an increasingly clean face to a second crux.
content.location: At the top of the Mahican wall trail. Almost in line with the maple tree. A belay bolt is on the last block before the starting ledge. Stick clip the first bolt to prevent a long fall down the slope.

content.description:
Starts out very technical and footwork intensive with small crimps before transitioning to steeper, more featured climbing.

 Tons of fun and maybe a little stiff for the grade.
Main climbing wall in the Hailles Cave South area. Access via a side trail up to a ledge ~20ft up from the main trail.
